thread.title: Elton John reunites with T Bone Burnett for new album, ‘Wonderful Crazy Night,’ due in Feb
thread.title_full: Elton John reunites with T Bone Burnett for new album, ‘Wonderful Crazy Night,’ due in Feb

author: News Staff
title: Elton John reunites with T Bone Burnett for new album, ‘Wonderful Crazy Night,’ due in Feb
text:
Posted Oct 22, 2015 8:37 am EDT 
LONDON – Elton John is still standing — and will release his 33rd studio album next year. 
John’s publicists announced Thursday that “Wonderful Crazy Night” is set for release on Island Records on Feb. 5. The first single, “Looking Up,” is out on Friday. 
“Wonderful Crazy Night” is co-produced by John and T Bone Burnett, who worked on the piano-playing star’s rootsy, well-received 2013 release “The Diving Board.” 
Lyrics are by Bernie Taupin, John’s songwriting partner of almost five decades. 
John, 68, is one of Britain’s most enduringly successful musicians, and a campaigner for gay rights around the world. He was knighted by Queen Elizabeth II in 1998 for his contributions to pop music and to the fight against AIDS. Join the conversation Sign in to comment (not connected to your Insider Club login).
